description: In the late 1930s Jackson Pollock became inspired by the work of the Mexican muralists José Clemente Orozco and David Alfaro Siqueiros. The expressionistic style of Untitled recalls Orozco murals that Pollock saw at Pomona and Dartmouth Colleges. The bullfight imagery evokes Picasso's famous Guernica, which made a powerful impression on Pollock when he saw the painting in 1939.
title: Untitled
